name.text: Determining the Area of an Annulus

questiontext.text:
Determine is the area of the annulus shown below? Leave your answer correct to \(3\,\text{ significant figures}\).

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-7, 7, 7, -7], axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); // Centre of circles (dot only, no label) var O = board.create('point', [0, 0], {fixed: true, visible:true, name: ''}); // Inner and outer circles (concentric) var inner = board.create('circle', [O, 3], { strokeWidth: 2, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 1 }); var outer = board.create('circle', [O, 5], { strokeWidth: 2, fillColor: 'white', fillOpacity: 0.4 }); // Points on inner and outer circles var P_inner = board.create('point', [3, 0], {size: 2, fixed: true, visible:true,name: ''}); var P_outer = board.create('point', [-4, 3], {size: 2, fixed: true, visible:true,name: ''}); // Dashed segments from O to points on circles board.create('segment', [O, P_inner], {dash: 2}); board.create('segment', [O, P_outer], {dash: 2}); // Labels for lengths board.create('text', [1.2, -0.8, '{#r#} cm']); board.create('text', [-2.5, 0.7, '{#R#} cm']); [[/jsxgraph]]

\(\text{Area of the annulus}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution:

An annulus is the region between two concentric circles.

From the diagram:

Inner radius \(= {@r@}\,\text{cm}\)
Outer radius = \(= {@R@}\,\text{cm}\) cm

Step 1: Write down the formula for the area of an annulus.

\(\begin{align} A &= \pi (R^2 - r^2) \end{align}\)

Step 2: Use \(\pi = \dfrac{22}{7}\).

\(\begin{align} A &= \frac{22}{7} (R^2 - r^2) \end{align}\)

Step 3: Substitute the values and evaluate.

\(\begin{align} A &= \frac{22}{7} \left( ({@R@})^2 - ({@r@})^2 \right) \\ &= {@A_1@}\ \text{cm}^2 \end{align}\)

Therefore, the area of the annulus \(= {@A_1@}\,\text{cm}^2\), \(\text{correct to 3 significant figures}\)\.
